WRITING.TEXT: Stop jerkin' your ego Noah XP Which reminds me I should post some stuff on here too (BTW it's Chun, if my username wasn't a dead giveaway)
I'm surprised no one pointed out that Superboy apparently has X-ray vision now. Or thermal?

I personal want to see Slobo or Lil Lobo. Which is kind of a long stretch considering his [origin](http://www.comicvine.com/slobo/29-46872/). I'm also surprised why there's such little mention of him here :(
Or the doctor from The Dark Knight Rises...
Dr. Neville, is that you?
Those shoes look great! May I ask where you got them?
Interesting that this is the first gen that the grass starter isn't remotely reptilian.
I work mostly in digital. Here's my [deviantart](http://subject1728.deviantart.com/)
I've been drawing nearly most of my life, but have been working as a freelancer since 2010. I draw pretty often for gaming companies but most of my work is under NDA.
No not big time...but I do get to make a living from doing what I love and that's all that counts. Thank you!
Thank you and sure thing you can ask away on here or note me on my deviantart.

Drawing a bunch is basically all there is to it. The more you practice the better you get. Be sure to do studies from reference and then implement what you learned into your next piece. As for sketching and scrapping don't worry about it keep at it until you find something you like within your sketches. It's actually more of a blessing to let go of ideas you feel that simply won't work in the beginning stages. Hope that helps you out.
All done in photoshop on my intuos 4 tablet.

WRITING.TITLE: Been on a monster movie binge this past weekend. Ended up drawing a little tribute to The Wolfman.

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks dude!
Thanks! a bit of both. I liked the original movie better than the 2010 remake, though I did love the transformations in the remake.
A lot of the classics like Dracula, The Wolfman, Frankenstein, and Creature from the Black Lagoon. I also watched some of the remakes(reboots). Gonna watch some of the versus movies soon :)
Thanks
Yea was anticipating more. I did like the atmosphere nonetheless less jump scares would've been nice.
Thanks! Any good werewolf media you would recommend? I've already watched The Wolfman, Ginger Snaps series, and some of Hemlock Grove. Looking for some more. :)

I'll give Wolf a try. Have heard of the movie before but was always hesitant seeing Jack Nicholson as a werewolf haha. Something about it seems hilarious for me. I saw An American Werewolf in Paris when I was 8, thoroughly enjoyed it then and definitely on my rewatch list. I loved the design and transformation of the werewolf(ves? well there were 2 of them) in Van Helsing! I never got into the Underworld films the way they modernized them was like awful fanfiction. I did enjoy the second Underworld film though particularly the beginning sequence with the vampires clad in armor and ultra aggressive werewolves set in the middle ages. Wish that was all of the movie.
and less jump scares... Thank you!
Thank you!
Thank you! I have the print up here: http://www.inprnt.com/gallery/subject1728/the-wolfman/
Thank you :)
Thanks haha

WRITING.TITLE: Recently I tried to teach myself how to paint in acrylics. This was the result. Enjoy!

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you!
I was going for more of a lovecraftian feel really.
Thanks!
All hail the King in Yellow!
Thank you!

Thank you! I would say prepare to experiment a lot, also adding water or using the paint opaquely introduces a variety of different options in how you go about a piece. Something very important I found out the hard way is to always have another sheet of paper or canvas next to you as a test sheet for colors and brushstrokes. You wouldn't want to constantly go back and fix up your mistakes thanks to a slightly different blend or weirdly shaped strokes. ;(
Thank you!!!!
Thank you!
Thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: I'm not very good at Long Sword, but I'm pretty proud of this

WRITING.TEXT: I'm so glad I clipped his toe XD
Make contact with R2+triangle with spirit gauge, then triangle again.
I said I wasn't very good! I'm sorry!
GS shoulder charge is definitely one of my favorite changes. Not only is it a great tool to get out of a mis-charge but cancelling charges into True Charge on sleeping monster is so satisfying!
I wasn't paying that much attention to numbers on my LS run but how much of an increase is a red helmsplitter?

Oh damn that's a lot of damage on the red helmsplitter. Yea I've totally messed up with helmsplitters before. For some reason I always have a hard time landing the final blow of the spirit combo to level up my spirit gauge, less so in World than in previous titles though. It feels like the spirit combo brings me pretty far from the monster sometimes, but I guess I just have to practice and manage my gauge better as I sometimes don't get the final slash for the level up. Also what do you think about the spirit parry move? I tried to parry Nerg's dive bomb...that didn't go so well.
The time for me was definitely the biggest factor for failing. I got him to sleep with my first try as dual blades and was setting down bombs then I ran out of time :/

Oh I'm so sorry that people keep on smacking him awake :/ I got lucky with a group in multi that knew what they were doing so we just stacked 8 bombs on him the moment he napped. I actually love the lance in World especially that running move, it's great for chasing limping monsters. Good luck on your hunt tho!
Make contact with R2+triangle with spirit gauge, then triangle again.
You have to combo into it. So a quick one would be O,R2+O. The R2+O is the parry.

I usually do triangle, triangle, O, fade slash into R2,R2,R2 when I get an opening. But I feel I get a bit away from the monster for the last hit of the spirit combo to hit some of the time, thus I don't level up my spirit gauge. Also I didn't know you could do foresight without a charge.
Yessss lol love MTG!
It's kanji for "Pacify"
Thank you!
Photoshop
Belgeist
